author: Reuters Editorial
title: Speculative U.S. 10-year T-note net shorts dip in week -CFTC
text: March 30 (Reuters) - Speculators' net bearish bets on U.S. 10-year Treasury note futures fell slightly earlier this week as the government sold a record $294 billion in debt supply, according to Commodity Futures Trading Commission data released on Friday. The amount of speculators' bearish, or short, positions in 10-year Treasury futures exceeded bullish, or long, positions by 305,212 contracts on March 27, according to the CFTC's latest Commitments of Traders data. A week earlier, speculators held 313,304 net short positions in 10-year T-note futures. Below is a table of the speculative positions in Treasury futures on the Chicago Board of Trade and in Eurodollar futures on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange in the latest week: U.S. 2-year T-notes (Contracts of $200,000) 27 Mar 2018 Prior week week Long 350,375 289,704 Short 463,602 473,740 Net -113,227 -184,036 U.S. 5-year T-notes (Contracts of $100,000) 27 Mar 2018 Prior week week Long 563,056 594,634 Short 997,661 1,059,359 Net -434,605 -464,725 U.S. 10-year T-notes (Contracts of $100,000) 27 Mar 2018 Prior week week Long 625,609 638,461 Short 930,821 951,765 Net -305,212 -313,304 U.S. T-bonds (Contracts of $100,000) 27 Mar 2018 Prior week week Long 168,746 171,137 Short 123,994 118,711 Net 44,752 52,426 U.S. Ultra T-bonds (Contracts of $100,000) 27 Mar 2018 Prior week week Long 48,196 52,164 Short 200,808 199,552 Net -152,612 -147,388 Eurodollar (Contracts of $1,000,000) 27 Mar 2018 Prior week week Long 1,005,507 878,130 Short 4,972,293 4,823,015 Net -3,966,786 -3,944,885 Fed funds (Contracts of $1,000,000) 27 Mar 2018 Prior week week Long 372,731 373,108 Short 257,427 268,476 Net 115,304 104,632 (Reporting by Richard Leong Editing by Susan Thomas)
